de.wwu.muggl.ui.gui.support
Class StepByStepExecutionRunner

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      de.wwu.muggl.ui.gui.support.StepByStepExecutionRunner
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class StepByStepExecutionRunner
extends java.lang.Thread

The StepByStepExecutionRunner will fork into a new thread. It is the link between step by step GUI and the virtual machine. Basically, the StepByStepExecutionComposite initializes the StepByStepExecutionRunner, which then sets up the virtual machine and controls it. By doing so, it is possible to step through applications, execute a couple of steps or "step over" an invocation instruction and any instructions connected to it (i.e. whole branches of an application). While the StepByStepExecutionRunner blocks on some occasions, the GUI thread always stays unlocked and offers full reactivity to user input. As a side effect, large parts of the step by step logic are encapsulated in this class.

Version:
1.0.0, 2010-03-18
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

Initialize the StepByStepExecutionRunner.

Parameters:
stepByStepExecutionComposite - The corresponding stepByStepExecutionComposite.
classLoader - The system MugglClassLoader.
classFile - The ClassFile which is executed first.
method - The method which is executed first.
Method Detail

setupApplication

public boolean setupApplication()
Set up the Application.

Returns:
true, if everything could be initialized successfully, false otherwise.

checkForMethodRefresh

public boolean checkForMethodRefresh()
Check if a refresh of the method is needed. If it is needed, load the current method data and return true. Simply return false otherwise.

Returns:
true, if a refresh of the method is needed, false otherwise.

hasExecutionFinished

public boolean hasExecutionFinished()
If the execution is finished, the buttons will be disabled and the machine state refreshed; the method then return true. It returns false otherwise.

Returns:
true, if the execution is finished, false otherwise.

abortExecution

public void abortExecution()
If an Application has been initialized, invoke its method to abort the execution.

stopExecution

public void stopExecution()
Stop the execution. For doing so, continueExecution is set to false. This will stop the execution a the next possible point.

run

public void run()
Start the execution. When this method is invoked, the next thread will be created and the virtual machine started.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

continueExecution

public void continueExecution()
Continue the execution. For doing so, continueExecution is set to true. This will let the execution continue in a short while.

getApplication

public Application getApplication()
Getter for the Application.

Returns:
The Application generated by this ExectionRunner.

setExecuteInfiniteSteps

public void setExecuteInfiniteSteps(boolean executeInfiniteSteps)
Setting the execution mode so that an infinite number of steps will be executed.

Parameters:
executeInfiniteSteps - If this argument is true, the execution of an infinite number of steps is enabled. It is disabled otherwise.
